trustfund: TF028184-REG. SECONDMENT ANTHROPOLOGIST (ASTHR),TF026081-USTDA CTF,TF023450-CANADIAN CONSULTANT TF FOR ENVIRONMENT,TF020350-DANISH CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND,TF025180-PHRD-GAS INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is rated
            unsatisfactory, sustainability unlikely, and institutional
            development impacts negligible, including unsatisfactory
            performances by both the Bank, and Borrower. Lessons
            address: 1) procurement, and training issues, which although
            procurement actions in the preparation for the A-B pipeline,
            development drilling at Rashidpur, and gas treatment plant
            were implemented in a timely fashion, prior to approval of
            the project, the procurement of technical assistance
            components, and the training component, surfaced during
            implementation, thus delaying implementation results.
            Instead, soft components should be initiated at an early
            stage of the project cycle; 2) despite an enabling private
            sector participation, the absence of specific actions by
            authorities to support this objective, hampered the efforts
            made by supervision missions to support restructuring, and
            reforms. Given the lack of consensus on reforms, more
            preparatory activities should have been carried out prior to
            project approval, and irreversible action, such as enactment
            of legislation, taken prior to effectiveness; and, 3)
            designing financial targets should have been considered, to
            be applicable on a consolidated basis, thus requiring
            consolidated accounts by Petrobangla, and, compliance with
            covenants should have required tariff policies, with tariff
            adjustments necessarily following, i.e. through indexation.
